summary: In 2020, Medicare spent about $9 billion on wheelchairs, oxygen, and other durable medical equipment. To save money and reduce fraud, Medicare implemented a competitive bidding program for suppliers to provide certain items in different geographic areas. Starting in 2021, to help ensure suppliers can back their bids, suppliers were required to get a $50,000 surety bond for each area they bid in. We found...
title: Medicare Durable Medical Equipment: Effect of New Bid Surety Bond Requirement on Small Supplier Participation in the Competitive Bidding Program
